title: Paralegal intake decision rules
description: Defines which legal intake requests require escalation and evidence capture.
content: Requests involving regulated data, litigation holds, or cross-border discovery trigger escalation to counsel. Routine contract review stays with paralegal unless turnaround exceeds 72 hours or exceptions are flagged.

title: Document triage exception categories
description: Rules that classify document triage exceptions for legal review.
content: Exceptions include missing signatures, conflicting versions, or documents tied to active litigation. Exceptions are routed to counsel with a required evidence checklist.

title: Medical billing exception ladder
description: Approval thresholds for billing exceptions and human review.
content: Exceptions above $5k or involving insurance disputes require supervisor approval. Missing documentation triggers a hold with a 48‑hour resolution window.

title: Claims documentation rules
description: Rules that determine claim completeness and escalation triggers.
content: Claims with missing provider authorization or mismatched diagnosis codes are flagged for manual review. Escalation is mandatory when disputes exceed 30 days.

title: Change order approval ladder
description: Approval thresholds for project delivery change orders.
content: Change orders below $50k can be approved by the project manager. $50k–$250k requires director approval. Above $250k triggers finance and legal review.

title: RAG citation integrity checklist
description: Checklist to keep retrieval outputs auditable and governed.
content: Every retrieved response must include the source document, section reference, and last review date. Objects without an owner are excluded from production retrieval.
